name: Attribute
description:
This are **attribute selectors** which provide selecting matching strings in the value of an attribute.
[info]These CSS3 selectors already occurred less powerful as attribute selectors in [`CSS2`](https://css4-selectors.com/selector/css2/attribute/ 'CSS2: Attribute').[/info]

sub_selectors.name: Prefix
sub_selectors.description: The prefix attribute selector matches an element whose attribute value (which should not be empty) starts with the prefix value.
sub_selectors.example_description: Here will have all `https://` links a red bottom border.

sub_selectors.name: Suffix
sub_selectors.description: The suffix attribute selector selects an element whose attribute value (which shouldn't be empty) ends with the suffix value.
sub_selectors.example_description: Every link with the ending of `.pdf` will have a red bottom border.

sub_selectors.name: Contains
sub_selectors.description: The contains attribute selector matches any element whose attribute value occurs at least one time.
sub_selectors.example_description: Every element which contains the value `example` get a dashed blue border.
